properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Robinvale. 
  • The bushfire on Knights Island, Robinvale is now contained.
  • Firefighters will monitor the area during the week. 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • This Community Information replaces the Advice issued at 4.59pm on 8 September 2025.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
COMMUNITY INFORMATION - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: 3.5Km East South East Of Robinvale
Issue Date: Tuesday 09 September 2025, 04:54 pm
Next Update: Friday 12 September 2025, 05:00 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/38150/moreinfo

This Community Information message is being issued for Robinvale. 
- The bushfire on Knights Island, Robinvale is now contained.
- Firefighters will monitor the area during the week. 
- Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
- This Community Information replaces the Advice issued at 4.59pm on 8 September 2025.


There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Kiewa River downstream of Mongans Bridge
properties.webBody:
This Minor Flood Warning is being issued for the Kiewa River downstream of Mongans Bridge.

River levels near the minor flood level at Bandiana.

River levels are elevated along the Kiewa River following recent rainfall. River levels are just below the minor flood level at Bandiana and are likely to remain around the minor flood level into Friday.

Kiewa River downstream of Mongans Bridge:
Minor flooding likely along the Kiewa River at Bandiana.

The Kiewa River at Bandiana is currently at 2.67 m and rising, just below the minor flood level. The Kiewa River at Bandiana is likely to remain around the minor flood level (2.80 m) for the remainder of Thursday and on Friday.
Stay informed - monitor your local conditions and remain alert.
What you should do: 
  • Be prepared to act if your situation changes.
  • Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
  • Farmers should consider moving livestock and machinery to higher ground.
  • Contact family members and neighbours to ensure they are aware of the situation.
Impacts in your area: 
  • High river levels and potential flooding in areas close to rivers and streams.
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

The next update is expected by 12/09/2025 01:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfloods)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact the National Relay Service and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Areas surrounding Porepunkah including Wangaratta and Mount Beauty
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for the incident at Porepunkah.
  • Victoria Police advise that the search for armed offender Desmond Freeman (Filby) continues in the broader Porepunkah area.
  • It is recommended that people travelling to Bright, Falls Creek or Mount Hotham avoid travelling through Porepunkah and instead, travel via Happy Valley Road at C534 and the Kiewa Valley Highway.
  • This Community Information message replaces the Community Information issued at 4:47pm Saturday, 6 September. 
If you see Desmond, call 000 immediately and do not approach him.
What you should do:
  • Anyone who has any information is asked to contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000 or www.crimestoppers.com.au.
Impacts in your area:
  • Road closures may change at short notice. 
  • Check the VicTraffic website for updates on road closures: traffic.transport.vic.gov.au.
  • Multiple police units remain in the general area of Porepunkah.
This message was issued by Victoria Police.

The next update is expected by 12/09/2025 02:20 pm or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency app
  • VicEmergency Facebook or Twitter
  • Victoria Police Facebook or Twitter
  • For more information, visit: Victoria Police - Porepunkah incident
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment, contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
COMMUNITY INFORMATION - DANGEROUS PERSON - Remain Vigilant
Incident Location: Areas surrounding Porepunkah including Wangaratta and Mount Beauty
Issue Date: Tuesday 09 September 2025, 02:16 pm
Next Update: Friday 12 September 2025, 02:20 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/38147/moreinfo

This Community Information message is being issued for the incident at Porepunkah.
- Victoria Police advise that the search for armed offender Desmond Freeman (Filby) continues in the broader Porepunkah area.   
- It is recommended that people travelling to Bright, Falls Creek or Mount Hotham avoid travelling through Porepunkah and instead, travel via Happy Valley Road at C534 and the Kiewa Valley Highway.
- This Community Information message replaces the Community Information issued at 4:47pm Saturday, 6 September. 


If you see Desmond, call 000 immediately and do not approach him.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Porepunkah. 
  • Victoria Police are searching for an armed and dangerous offender Desmond Freeman (Filby) in the area of Porepunkah.
  • Travel in the area should be restricted to essential activities only.
  • This Advice message replaces the Advice issued at 7:34PM Sunday, 7 September.
If you see Desmond Freeman (Filby), call 000 immediately and do not approach the offender. 
What you should do:
  • If you are in the Porepunkah area, you must follow instructions of emergency services at the scene.
  • Anyone with information is asked to call 000 immediately, or contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 333 or www.crimestoppers.com.au.
If you are outside the warning area:
  • Avoid the broader Porepunkah area.
  • Follow roadblocks and traffic diversions.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Road closures may change at short notice. 
  • Check the VicTraffic website for updates on road closures: traffic.transport.vic.gov.au.
This message is being issued by Victoria Police. 

The next update is expected by 12/09/2025 02:30 pm or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency app
  • VicEmergency Facebook or Twitter
  • Victoria Police Facebook or Twitter
  • For more information, visit: Victoria Police - Porepunkah incident
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • if you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact the National Relay Service and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
